text.intro: I am a linguist specializing in Slavic languages, particularly Russian, Czech, and Polish.
text.methods: My research integrates a variety of methods, including corpus and computational linguistics as well as experimental techniques.
text.phd: I received my PhD in 2023 from the University of Cologne in the field of Slavic Linguistics, with a focus on identity-driven morphosyntactic variation of Russian and Czech nonbinary speakers.
text.work: I am a research fellow in Slavic Linguistics at the Slavic Department as well as in the Key Profile Area “Skills and Structures in Language and Cognition” (SSLAC) at the University of Cologne.

corpus.heading: Czech multimodal conversation corpus
corpus.description1: This multimodal corpus is a collection of video and speech recordings of face-to-face dialogues of native Czech speakers aged from 20-30 years old. A total of 17 one-hour conversations were recorded at the University of Liberec in November 2025. The participants were allowed to talk about any topic they wanted. The data were recorded using a frontal view HD camera and a microphone for each speaker, a third HD camera for a side view, and an additional frontal speaker view using LiveLink (iPhone), respectively.
corpus.description2: Data cleaning and preparation is currently underway, including automatic speech transcription, PoS-tagging, lemmatization and gesture annotation in ELAN, as well as facial signals such as eye gaze, eye blinks and eyebrows based on the LiveLink data.
